abstract: Sec of State John Kerry talks with Iranian foreign minister Javad Zarif to seek Iran’s help in ending Syrian crisis, reversing American position that Iran should not be part of peace process because of its support of Pres Bashar al-Assad; gains made by Islamic State terrorists, expansion of Russian military support for Assad and refugees pouring into Europe likely propel Kerry's change of heart.
lead_paragraph: The secretary of State reached out to the Iranians at the United Nations on Saturday despite concerns about the country’s support for the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Shifting Direction, Kerry Aims to Include Iran in Efforts to End the Conflict in Syria
headline.print_headline: Shifting Direction, Kerry Aims to Include Iran in Efforts to End the Conflict in Syria

snippet: The secretary of State reached out to the Iranians at the United Nations on Saturday despite concerns about the country’s support for the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad.
